intro: Nemesia acornis, commonly known as the acorn nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink, white, and purple. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and often branched. Nemesia acornis thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
